5)     Thou shalt not kill, dn/dt=Ñun

6)    Thou shalt not commit adultery; ds/dt=0

7)     Thou shalt not steal;(r+p)Ñu=-g+uÄu·Ñp

8)     Thou shalt not bear false witness; [same]

9)     Thou shalt not covet thy neighbor’s house; [same]

10) Thou shalt not covet thy neighbor’s wife, u· u = -1

 

The proportionality of the ten components of the Einstein tensor and the energy stress tensor are parallel to the ten sephirot of the point of wisdom and the ten of the point of understanding. However, there must be another ten-component tensor that we are not aware of since there is also the ten sephirot of the point of the crown which hasn't been accounted for. [I am assuming the 6 sephirot of Zeir and the one of malchut relate to just the physical manifestation of the higher points.]

 

The question, however, is how is the breaking of the vessels reflected in the physical realm? Is this the law of uncertainty that will be rectified after the revival of the dead? How can a law that is so much in the fabric of the universe be rectified? Don't we correct the breaking of the vessels every day by prayer, and certainly the law of uncertainty doesn't change from day to day. The answer apparently is that this law also has its roots in the circular sephirot which will be united with the straight ones at the revival, but not change their essential character.

 

·

 

A more traditional approach would be that in 5-d spiritual space the three dimensions are 6 lower sephirot as per the directions of Rabbi Luria for the lulav, (we'll call the entire kindness and anti-kindness (power) direction just by k, beauty and anti-beauty (foundation) by b, and victory and anti-victory (splendor) by v. Then crown and anti-crown (royalty) we'll call c, and Wisdom and understanding by w. Thus, the stress tensor is:

 

T = itk + jtb + ktv + ltw + mtc. (This involves more than ten components).

 

·

 

The Empty space should be limited to some dimensions, not infinite dimensional, and the straight light coming down should be one dimension less. The reason I think it has to be finite dimensional is so that a description of it will be necessary and sufficient. Only to God is the near the same as the far but as we describe distances and time even in a spiritual way the description has to be confined to some limited number of dimensions to have any meaning.

 

·

 

The empty space rotates on its axis and revolves around a center point and one outside itself and this produces the flux's that enters it. The rotation causes it to be in the form of an ellipsoid i.e.

 

X2/ a2 + y2 / b2 + z2 / c2 = 1.

 

·

 

The empty space has the quality of hiding the light of God, and every level of hiding hides the previous level so one doesn't know that God is hidden and thinks he is close to God. And that level is hidden by another level in a continuous progression. Each level is a different level of darkness. The character of God's Infinite Light is that as it progresses further down through the darkness it illuminates one more level of hiding. Every higher level of light that comes into the world defuses a greater degree of darkness.

 

·

 

Since the empty space is rotating it must have an ergosphere.

·

 

The singularity in the center of the empty space is connected to the light surrounding the space through an outside dimension.

The ten circular sephirot are actually energy waves emanating from the vibration of the roof of the empty space. The dot in the middle also vibrates and gives off its own circular sephirot. So actually Faith, Sexual purity etc., are actually energy waves. Every individual gives them off by the degree he holds on to every trait.

 

·

 

The area under the singularity of the infinite light is negative time, to the right is positive space, to the left negative space from where the worlds of negative probabilities emerge. Imaginary space is the opposite side.

 

·

 

The center of the empty space which is the singularity of the infinite light gives off waves like a drop falling on a lake which are its circular sephirot as opposed to the circular sephirot which enter the empty space from above.

 

·

 

What makes the world line of the circular sephirot [the Igulim] tilt away from the vertical is the speed they rotate through the empty space. Since they rotate at speeds faster than light, they have horizontal world lines. The circular form of those sephirot is due to the fact they are traveling in a time field which causes them to bend, just like an electron traveling at an angle to a magnetic field. (The straight sephirot are time-like [They travel slower than the speed of the light, so the Eitz Chayim refers to them as if they were stationary which only means that they are an inertial frame of reference) and the circular sephirot are space-like.)

 

·

 

Since the empty space is finite without boundaries, and in the opinion of the Ramchal it refers to time and space one can travel indefinitely in one direction in time as we are in fact doing and find ourselves at the beginning of time at the top of the empty space.

Thus, the sephirot are closed with regard to observer in spiritual 4-d space but a long cylinder from the aspect of 5-d space. The probability density of the vessel of each sephirah varies inversely as the square of the distance from the center since density of (x, y, z) = k / r2 so M=òòò (x,y,z)dV = 4kr unit amot. Binah is composed of higher and lower levels, as the Ari goes into at great length.

The 22 Hebrew letters have numerical value, but they also represent functions.

 

Specifically, the 10 letters which represent the 10 sephirot, t”vdyps t”rpB d”gb s”ma are representative of 10 functions, depending on what world you are in: In Emanation of math they are the Gamma function, the Beta function, the Bessel function, Fourier Integral, Legendre function, the error function, the complementary error function, the sine integral, the cosine integral, Fresnel function, Fresnel cosine function.

·

 

It's clear that the Vessels were broken because of there being too much energy inside the vessel (so if there was let's say a lower sephirah's light it would be o.k.). So, when before he says the vessels weren't fixed as one male and female it would seem he means that if the vessels would have been fixed as one there would have been strength to hold the light. However, why in the higher sephirot weren't they broken? It would seem that this is because the light of the Crown was made to hold its very intense light so the rest of the light couldn't break it. They all have the same wavelength, when they are up there in the Crown, but the lower light has a smaller amplitude, so the amplitudes combine but don't break the vessel since its made for that wavelength. But the problem with this is that shouldn't the vessel break at their own resonance frequency? Perhaps the nekudim are spiritual neutrons that are absorbed into the vessels and cause them to break apart by atomic fission. Its not that they break by the force of the impact. The breaking of the vessels was a chain reaction. The energy given off was (The mass of the sephirot)(The speed of the Infinite Light) ²

 

·

 

The higher worlds of the Kabbalah are not higher in the conventional sense but rather at a 90° angle to our 3D space. As the electrons (the letters of the alphabet) flow through the sephirot an outer magnetic field is generated. It would seem the physical universe is surrounded by Formation outside, in terms of the circular sephirot (in plain 3D terms) -- but there the world is spiritual, and that “up” also means in one more direction up in terms of the straight sephirot. In the middle of the empty space, it would seem there is a singularity, the most inner point of the circular sephirot, for as they progress towards the center, they become more physical until you get a type of Higgs Field that transforms spiritual energy into physical. The Eitz Chayim is all about the straight sephirot and doesn't deal with the circular ones which are the spiritual root of non-Jews, and the fields of the physical universe.

It seems from this that as God puts more energy into the empty space the radius gets bigger. The singularity of infinite light in the center of the empty space is what causes it to be curved. The outer light surrounding the straight sephirot is the magnetic field from the name 52 surrounding a current-bearing conductor of the light of the name 45. The circular sephirot are rotating in an external magnetic field and that is how they create the electric current of the straight sephirot, as the sages said, “there is a sphere that circles around in the world”.

 

(The Circular sephirot are 3­D spheres rotating sideways into the 4th spiritual dimension). (Since they are accelerating, they give out gravitational waves also, which also affects the straight sephirot. Obviously, the broken vessels give out gravitational waves also as they fall and later rise). (The straight sephirot have to be electric since they are straight and don't make a complete circle like a magnetic field). This leaves us with figuring out how the next 3 forces relate to the names 63 and 72 and this certainly seems to imply that the straight lines of gravity are produced by some rotating outer field of some higher force surrounding the 3 dimensions of the universe.

You use a grid to make a change in the plate current (the source of the light) by small changes in the grid potential that is caused by mitzvot and good deeds. The distance between the sephirah of the crown and wisdom is (2-1) (r) if r is the radius of the empty space. (As you continue down you keep the same order). (As the empty space expands and contracts the radius varies, so at one period in time one might be able to rise from one level to the next easily since there is just a small distance to go and at other periods in history or in one's own life it might be very difficult). (As we progress toward the singularity in the center, humanity goes from one level to the next very quickly. I know many people have wondered why it took humanity such a long time to make any slight bit of progress in the olden days while now it seems every 10 years, we enter into a new century. (And every century is 1000 years of the old time). However, the expanding of the empty space caused a spiritual red shift of the light as it came down to us. One of the reasons that the light that we receive in the physical universe is much denser and more physical than the spiritual light in the higher worlds is that the light has gone through the whole empty space to reach us, and that empty space is expanding so there is a red shift in the frequency of the light. So, this explains why to the Ari there is a change is the essential nature of the light as it travels a distance in the higher worlds.

The top of the spiritual empty space is the top of the future light cone. The world inside it is made of time-like directions. We are going down in it because from the aspect of Einstein's equations (time is a negative coordinate) the right side is positive space the left is negative space - where the particles of negative probabilities emerge from. The bottom side of the singularity of the infinite light is negative time:

 

 

 

·

 

The orientation of the sephirot is either right handed, left handed or zero spin. Their position in regard to each other is as is stated in the Eitz Chayim, however they also have spin. The Right hand Sephirot have right-hand spin, the middle none, and the left have left-hand spin. Splendor and Eternity have half integer spin and are thus subject to Fermi Statistics. Kindness and Power have whole integer spin and are thus subject to Einstein-Bose Statistics. One result of this is that any flow coming from the right-handed sephirot like kindness or Wisdom will have integer-spin like Photons or in general any particles whose exchange generates some interaction. This is a problem, for bosons carry all the interactions -- so aren't there left-handed interactions from the sephirot of power? The answer is that there are only four interactions, from the names 72 (right), 63 (left), 45 (right), 52 (left), and the four are always symmetric until some Higgs field breaks the symmetry.

 

·

 

Since Royalty and Beauty are rotating on their own axis, they emit wave radiation from of the four types of waves (72, 63, 45, 52). Since Royalty rotates around Beauty they consist of a closed system, and give off Name-72 waves, which involves a loss of their energy of motion and rest energy. Therefore, they need to receive more energy into order to keep up the oscillation. (If not, they just float away as name 72 radiation waves.

 

·

 

The singularity in the center of the empty space is a white hole not surrounded by an event horizon, which spews out spiritual mass and energy, not subject to the laws of spiritual physics. It has its own circular and straight sephirot outside of it. Its surface is our four dimensional world. The inside I think is a different type of continuation of the process of the evolving of the spiritual worlds in the regular empty space.

·

 

Since the whole universe is analytic it can be expanded into a Taylor series (that's why one needs to get married i.e., in order to continue the series.) The circular sephirot are analytic but the straight sephirot are not. But the bottom seven sephirot of the generality of the worlds [all taken as one] are analytic because they are like cylinders.

 

·

 

Sephirot are a vector space since the operations of addition and multiplication apply to them. Multiplication by the sephirot is what the kabbalah calls mating, for addition is just adding two things [of the same essence] together, while mating is applying the value of one thing to the value of another in order to come out with a greater (or lesser) result.

 

·

 

The circular sephirot are analytic since they have a derivative everywhere. I don't know about the straight ones since even though they are called straight they are formed like cylinders.

 

·

 

The Torah is linearly independent, i.e.,

b1 r1 e1 i1 s1 h1 i1 t1 + b2 a2 r2 e2 +… = The numerical value of the verse.

This is the intent of the sages when they say, “there is no freedom except for Torah.” With the first verse of the Torah, it is possible to show this even in the form it is in in the Torah, for it can be put into Echelon form:

The linearly independent solutions are related to one homogeneous differential equation of order six. Apparently, that is the equation of the Creation.

 

The torsion of the verse has to be more than zero which gives us a right-handed system of sephirot since the vectors described are independent.

 

So Sciyi (x) 1 0 for all c: And so, the Wronskian determinant doesn't vanish at the origin. So, the torsion 1 0 So we have either right handed or left handed sephirot since,

 

 

However, the general system according to the Kabbalah is that the top row of the matrix is the beginning letters of every word of the verse, the middle row of the matrix is the middle letters, and the last row is the last letters of each word. So, for example the first verse is a 3 times 7 matrix.

The metric here is given by the divine name of the four letters:

 

 

The Divine name, which indicates that God is the Force of forces is “God”, or “Elohim”. The five letters of this name correspond to the five components of the equation for the total force on any specific volume, oyhla = F(total) = n cosTds. The basic three letters are the basic name which is the basic equation with the dot after the lamed indicating the dot product and the mistakes the word plural and thus indicates the sum of all the forces which is the integral sign. In its inner essence this equation is the divine name of the four letters hvhy.

 

The h is the ds, the small surface, the y is the tension, the v is the normal to the surface and the first h is the cos of the angle between the tension and the normal to the surface.

Now this is the scheme of Creation as we can see on every levelfrom this diagram of the the Genetic Code, the Godel Code together with the order of the higher worlds

and the formula for the curvature of space -time.

·

 

The normal representation of the commandments is a square matrix (613 x 613).

tefilin of tefilin + shabat of tefilin + tzitzit of tefilin + ……

shabat of shabat+tefilin of Shabat + ...

 

Then, after the correction the order switched, and you take the transpose of the above matrix. So that tefilin becomes only tefilin, i.e., tefilin of tefilin + tefilin of Shabat + Tefilin of Tzitzit + …

 

This is actually the opinion of Beit Shamai according to Rabbi Yochanan at the beginning of Pesachim.

 

·

 

The commandments of the Bible acting on a complex finite dimensional inner product soul, can be represented by a triangular matrix relative to an orthonormal basis of the soul. [The determinate of that matrix will give you the volume of light it contains. Now, this explains why in some places in the Eitz Chayim the higher worlds are represented as square and even after the revival of the dead the order will be the transpose of the present order. While in other places the order is like a triangle like this.

 

*a = 72 of 72 crown.

*b = Wisdom of 72 in the crown of 63.

*c = Understanding of 72 in the wisdom of 63 in the crown of emanation.

*d = Beauty and royalty in understanding of 63 of AK in wisdom and understanding.

*A = crown of 63

*B = wisdom of 63 in crown of emanation

*C = understanding of 63 inside of wisdom and understanding of emanation [horizontally speaking]

*D = Beauty and royalty of 63 of AK inside of Israel and the lower understanding of emanation until the bottom.

*E=crown of emanation

*F=wisdom and understanding of emanation.

*G=Israel and the lower understanding of emanation.

*H=Beauty and Royalty of Emanation. The right column is all 72, the middle is all 63 and the left is emanation.

 

·

 

There are ten empty spaces, and each is divisible into ten, which are divisible into ten ad infinitum. Each one is on a different plane, i.e., the three dimensional sphere is surrounded by a 4-D sphere which is surrounded etc. Each has its own surrounding sephirot in its own dimension. For instance, our empty space is surrounded by Royalty of the Infinite One which is surrounded etc. Like this:

 

 

A = The empty space.

b = Top of the empty space, circular Royalty of the Infinite One.

c = Square royalty of the Infinite One. This is what the Kabbalists of the Middle Ages call the Royalty of the Infinite One. However, I haven't seen the Ari mention it.

d = Circular foundation.

e = Square foundation. The square sephirot are the source of the linear sephirot in the empty space. The lines coming down from the top to the center are the roots of the sephirot in the shape of an Eagle.

 

The lines of the left side are the root of the sephirot in the shape of a lion. The right is the root of the Bull. The lines coming up to the center are the sephirot of Adam Kadmon, the sephirot in the shape of a person, which is the general subject of the Eitz Chayim. The time-axis is negative, so to get the regular order we are used to you have to turn it upside down. This, it seems, is the root of the Baal Hatanya's idea of equating tohu [chaos] with the angles of the Divine Chariot.

 

The idea of turning the whole thing over is Rabbi Nachman's of man ruling over the angels.

 

[I know there are many times when it seems the Baal Hatanya has no source in the Kabbalah but with patience, I have usually found some source for him. For instance, it bothered me a long time that he equated the higher Unification with the higher knowledge. Now that has no way of working with the Drush HaDaat at the end of the Eitz Chayim. Eventually, I discovered that the commentary on the Rashash, the Shemen Sasson, says Drush HaDaat is only the generality of the Emanation and in fact doesn't work with the specifics, and that the higher Israel and Understanding are half of The Father and the Mother.]

 

The ten traits of the five basic sephirot are bases for those sephirot. i.e., they are linearly independent.

 

·

 

The Zohar says there are nine palaces above the sephirot that are not light or spirit or souls. They are, in the spiritual realm, the equivalent of the nine components of the force-density tensor.

 

This is because they are made, as the Zohar says, by the impulses of the nine lower sephirot on the crown. [Even though I have not seen this anywhere, I suppose these nine “palaces” are the eight white hairs of Arich, and the first tikun of the beard which come to Zeir Anpin.]

  Beauty(=Tyyj) +

  Kindness(=Tyzk)

  Eternity (= Tzzk)

i = MOTHER = INTERPRETATION [conversion to meaningful form] = transcription [conversion to active form]

j = Nukvah, (wife, daughter) = translation by genetic code = arithmetization by Gödel Code.

 

g = ARICH ANPIN = self-reference = self-reproduction

 

This system exists throughout Creation and is the horizontal brick for the vertical layers. [It has already been shown that Quantum Mechanics is easily described by a formal system of Mathematical logic.]

 

 

·

 

It seems to go without saying, but Hebrew is obviously a formal mathematical system with specific rules like where ever there is a He at the end of a string it can be replaced by a Vav Tav or wherever there is a 5 it can be replaced by a 6; 400 or wherever there is a Royalty of Beauty it can be replaced by Beauty of Beauty and the entire sepherah of Royalty.

 

·

As we can see from this diagram

†

 

Each sepherah represents a different plane of existence. So, for example the world of logic [the sepherah of wisdom] is one level of reality, while the world of the light [the sepherah of the crown] is another level.

 

Neither one is more nor less real than the other, just each one is different. So, the fact that some people get a certain light by meditation doesn't cancel the validity of the world of logic. The connection between each world is the Strange Loops that exist in each one.

 

For instance, “This sentence is false.” This explains why morality isn't rational, for morality stems from the lower six sepherot [except for the bottom] and can't claim to be rational — which is from the world of logic. The light inside each one is circulating, so attachment to any sepherah takes one in a somewhat circular path.

 

The Strange Loop inside of morality is thus:

·      Kindness dictates giving with no limit.

·      Judgement indicates punishment without limit.

·      Each limits the other to come to Justice [the middle sepherah-beauty], i.e., its’ two infinite sets that cancel to come to the synthesis of giving only what you own yourself, and not to take from the rich to give to the poor.

 

·

 

Each sepherah has its own rules for people: the rules of the Torah come from Beauty, the laws of the country one lives in come from Royalty. Thus, just because one follows the laws of the Torah [Beauty] that does't mean one is permitted to transgress the laws of one's country. And if one does so, Royalty itself takes revenge.

 

The rules of Foundation are related to sexual purity.

 

The rules of Wisdom are related to learning Wisdom and not making mistakes in the ten subjects of wisdom: Math, Physics, Chemistry, Logic, Biology, Music, Philosophy, Kabbalah [i.e., the three highest ones]. Of course, people that are more associated with one sepherah particularly [or their root is there] must be more careful than others in matters relating to that sepherah.

                                                

·

 

A person with only a nefesh has a straight world line. A person with spirit has a second-order curve as a world line. A person with neshamah [soul] has a third order curve. If he has nefesh of the Neshamah, i.e., world line is Neil's parabola where he reaches the Origin just once.unless his function is recurring.

 

The five levels of the soul are a Neils Parabola, the Witch of Agnesi, the Folium of Descartes, the Cissoid and the Strophoid.

 

If he has one of the five levels of the Chaya also, his world line follows the pattern of the five types of curves of the fourth order, the  Cochoids of Nicomedes, the Limacon of Pascal, the Cardioid, the Cassinian Oval, or the Lemniscate.

 

 

 

Chapter 2   - Roots of Science

 

Introduction

Science and Kabbalah are two distinct fields with apparently no relationship between them. Yet Einstein wrote that the object of all science is to coordinate our experiences and to bring them into a logical system. He also said that there is no real qualitative difference between those sense perceptions which are common to different individuals (and in that sense impersonal) and those which are experienced by only one person. Those which are common to different people are really no more factual than those which are experienced by one. Kabbalah involves personal experience which however can be verified by its effects in the inter-personal world.

 

It's my hope that this section will coordinate experience (spiritual and scientific) and bring them all into a logical system.

 

It is also my hope to show how Science and Kabbalah can illuminate the other as long as each keeps its respective parameters in mind. When either forgets it's boundaries it usually does notoriously badly. Physics describes reality based on models taken from every day experience and these models work. I am trying here to find what the true inner model of Physics is by using the Kabbalah, i.e., I'm trying to find the spiritual realities upon which the physical world is based.

 

·

 

The two kinds of circular and straight sephirot are the root of the uncertainty of the continuum hypothesis (that Cantor hypothesized that there is no set that has a cardinal number between a0 (the cardinal number of elements of the set of all natural numbers) and “c” (the cardinal number of the set of all rational and irrational numbers) where each kind of valid math can be built on either opposite assumption.

 

·

 

The circular sephirot have a base of p. In turn the root of that is the contradiction of the emptiness of the empty space though it must have the presence of God in it. (The emptiness is Godliness, but we can't find God there.)

 

·

 

Perhaps gravity has a counterpart like the electric force with the magnetic force -- and that something could cause a red shift in gravity waves like gravity causes for light waves. [In General Relativity, gravity is conservative, like the electric force. I wonder about a possible counterpart like the magnetic force. At any rate, since everything in creation seems to contain Strange Loops, I would imagine that the universe does form a loop and though gravity doesn't form loops on a small scale perhaps it does on a large scale. Perhaps this could explain the fact that the galaxies don't fly apart. If gravity is in fact like the electromagnetic force, if it would change over the course of time, you would get its counterpart. Now any accelerating system like the earth and the sun [or the galaxy] is changing over time, so perhaps this system is emitting some other type of waves besides gravitational waves. Yet since the density of the galaxy is so small, we just don't notice it.

 

·

 

The light of the sephirot isn't all the same, but the light of 52 is a spiritual-electric field and the light of 45 is a magnetic field and together they create a spiritual electromagnetic wave by the oscillation of the name 52 at the top of the empty space.

 

·

 

 is an inverse square law just like  because speed is a measure of space-time like length is a measure of space. So, the force that turns energy to matter is an inverse square force. (So, if c was a variable, the less it would be, the more mass you would have, so c2 takes the place of r2 in a higher realm. But what would come after that a2, the acceleration of light? And after that, I guess, would be the change in the acceleration with respect to time, and so for every dimension up you add.

 

·

 

Current is described by a differential equation that has a solution only with a complex number. Perhaps that is because mass has a complex part of itself as in .

 

That is the same part that can travel faster than light.

 

Mass that is infinite can travel at the speed of light and that mass is , i.e., the first uncountable type of infinity that can be contained within some limit, like  .

 

It is probably obvious to most scientists, but since I haven't seen this mentioned anywhere, I think it is proper to say this. The inverse square laws are a result of the fact that the surface area of the sphere is , i.e., since the force coming out of any object is diluted over the area of a sphere the further out you go, gravity or the electromagnetic force must be reduced by a factor of r2.

 

Every physical body has extension into imaginary space (not the fourth dimension, but into space times 'I'). This makes every mass, even if in a random chaotic shape, symmetrical. If you stop the vibrations at the nodes, you increase the frequency which increases the energy. This particularly should apply to the strings of which the atom is made. Also, to the galactic strings, so that at places where the galaxies don't form there should be an increase of energy. [Looking at this now I am not so sure for wasn't that the independent variable idea with the electron i.e., how someone wanted to explain the uncertainty of electron, and I seem to recall that was refuted experimentally. However, the imaginary numbers do seem to pop up in the most common places like electric current]

 

·

 

The order of adding up the electrons to the chemical elements and the order of the unification table and the order of the table for proving the equivalence of the set of positive rational fractions with all natural numbers [Cantor's diagonal method] and the way of doing certain continuous integrals like <???>  ò(x3)(ex) is the same pattern of the parallel 45-degree lines through the table:

 

The root of this is the fact that at the beginning before the correction the order of the worlds was horizontal, then it changed to vertical e.g., the mitzvah of teffilin had all the other mitzvot in it, like Shabbat of tefillin, prayer of tefillin etc. Then it was changed to take the tefillin of all the other mitzvot and put them into tefillin so that tefillin is only tefillin, i.e., tefillin of Shabbat, tefilin of prayer etc., this happened in all the world so the order of all the worlds was switched. The sixteen levels of this GUT relate to the sixteen components of the stress energy tensor (even though it reduces down to ten components) which is related on the next parallel level of the Typo-genetic Code by which each pair of ACGT codes for an amino acid, thus;

Each level of the hierarchy of Creation is based on similar matrices. This is why the diagonal functions keep showing up like the trace [for Cantor], the determinant [for the volume of the universe], characteristic polynomials, the relation between each level of creation is thus;

 

If A is the matrix of the Genetic Code and B is that of the table of the elements, then A = P - 1 BP. Now we have to find Matrix P to get the connection, and P-1 represent the two Strange Loops on every level like the two ladders of the double helix of the DNA.

 

Now we can learn from this that if f[B]=f[A], then f[T] = f[T]s. So, the function that works between levels can also work on the same level on the inverse base of that level. The question is what operations does this describe for TNT or the Genetic Code or Emanation Creation Formation and Space-time?

 

The diagonal argument seems to run thought creation as we see above, [i.e., the matrices of every level seem to have this weird affinity with the diagonal] I would like to suggest. then the Genetic Code and this GUT and the table of elements can all be represented by a diagonal matrix such that.

 

T(u1) = k1u1

T(u2) = k2u2

...................

T(un)=  knun

 

 

Thus, the eigenvectors u11, u2...un are linearly independent. This suggests that every substance, life, atoms, etc., are four-dimensional creatures but the elementary particles of the GUT scheme are five dimensional.

 

Thus, it seems that there was some flattening out process between the creation of the elementary particles and the forming of atoms.

 

·

 

Perhaps the universe is expanding inside another 5-D universe which is expanding inside a 6-d universe etc., to infinity.

 

·

 

Perhaps the physical expansion of the Universe in 3-Dimensional space is due to the fact that the universe is described by a matrix. The determinant of that matrix gives the volume of the universe.

 

·

 

Space is a set of infinities (Cantor's Infinities), (these are the substances of Spinoza). This is the deeper meaning of the infinities of the electron.

 

·

 

The 1st 100 elements were divided into 10 sephirot, e.g., hydrogen is royalty of royalty, helium is Foundation of Royalty. (After the correction helium is Royalty of Foundation.)

 

·

 

It seems possible that the 12 elementary substances that The Book of Creation (sefer Yetzirah) refers to, are the six quark flavors and six leptons. The 8-gluons of the strong interaction plus the two gluons of the electro­-weak interaction (the photon and weak boson), are the light of the sephirot of the physical universe. It’s amazing that in the Eitz Chayim, in the description of akudim, we find light interacting with light which predicted the existence of gluons besides the photon. The 6 quarks are the 6 sephirot of Zeir Anpin,

 

cgt + nhi = ud + cs + tb

 

(Kindness)(Judgement)(Beauty)+(Victory)(Splendor)(Foundation)=(up)(down)+

(charm)(strange)+(truth) (beauty) [Or in the new notation (top0(bottom)] and the six leptons are the 6 sephirot of nukba, while the light is drawn from the higher sephirot. Another way of looking at it is the particles correspond to the right hand and left hand sephirot i.e., wisdom, kindness, victory = top, charm up and understanding, power, splendor = strange, down, bottom and the middle interaction gluons are the middle mediating sephirot.

 

·

 

The wave-particle duality is from the root of the circular and straight sephirot which led to the two worlds Akudim (streaked-waves) and Nekudim (dotted-particles), which in turn led to the doubts that arise in the raisha delo isyada (the peak that is impossible to know, which the Eitz Chayim goes into great length to explain what the doubts that are that are there. It's interesting to note the doubts of the uncertainty principle arise from the wave particle duality and the doubts in the unknown peak arise from the duality of the streaked and spotted worlds.

 

·

 

Electro-magnetic waves are a combination of the light of 45 and 52 -- (45 is the electric part).

 

·

 

The Lorentz transformation is identified in terms of 10 parameters:

·      The relative velocity.

·      The 3 top sephirot.

·      The angles between the spatial coordinates (the 3 middle sephirot), and

·      The space-time coordinates of the origin of one coordinate system with respect to the other (the 4 lower sephirot).

 

Since velocity corresponds to the 3 higher sephirot, the velocity of light is the same in all frames of reference -- since it is above space and time. (The concept of the higher 3 sephirot being above space and time is a very common concept in Kabbalah). (To the photons themselves time doesn't move, all space is one point, and its equivalent mass at that velocity is undefined.) (It's also well known that the 3 middle ones refer to the directions of space.)

 

·

 

The first 100 elements are divided into the 10 sephirot of rulership of the physical universe e.g., hydrogen is rulership of rulership. Helium is the foundation of rulership. But after the correction helium is rulership of foundation, etc., and the order is vertical, not horizontal (as Rabbi Sar Shalom Sharabi explains in Nahar Shalom)

 

·

 

7 rows of the periodic table correspond to the seven levels surrounding royalty, and the four orbitals (s, p, d, f) are the four letters of the Ineffable Name.

 

·

 

The 10 sephirot of electro-magnetic radiation are:

1.      Gamma rays.

2.      X- rays.

3.      Ultra-violet is the first three sephirot.

4.      The visible spectrum is parallel to the 6 sephirot of Beauty (violet, indigo, blue, green, yellow, orange). Red, infrared and radio waves are Royalty.

 

 

All these are the sephirot of the light while the elements are sephirot of the vessels.

 

·

 

When we view the world from the Unification Table, we see that each particle can be reduced to some set of 5 binary numbers just like in any computer, and the state of the universe is given by the fields associated with these particles (as Frank Wilczek writes in Longing for the Harmonies). This is because the 10 sephirot are really 5 (as Rabbi Chayim Vital explains at the end of the Eitz Chayim that there really are only 5 but they are known as 10 for the 6th of Zeir Anpin are really just characteristics of Beauty -- not individual sephirot). And each universe consists of combinations of the 5 sephirot. So, the physical universe is an intricate “computer” program of the world of Formation on the “computer” of Creation, and so on.

 

·

 

There is a spiritual space and time just like the physical. The laws of the spiritual space-time continuum are the Divine Names and unifications which are parallel to the mathematical formulas in the physical realm. (This explains the idea that Yom Kippur is above time i.e., the spiritual time-flow, not the physical. Also, this explains different statements of the Sages about the universe, which seem to contradict the physical one (as the Ramchal says).

 

Why then is math and physics considered holy to the Rambam? — because if it is connected to fear of God it is the vessel for the higher holiness, and the explanation of the higher sepherot, and the singularity of the infinite light in the center of the empty space makes it the center of the physical realm.

 

Also, since Royalty is connected directly to the Crown, when it goes up it is immediately attached to the Crown — similar to the fact that the highest holiness can be reached only in the physical world by doing the physical commandments, not in the higher worlds, for only here shines the light of the Crown.

 

Also, the hidden holiness of science and math stems from the fact that the formulas are the Divine unifications of the circular sephirot.

 

·

 

Darkness, which the Talmud implies is a creation in itself refers to the electro-magnetic field that permeates the universe which isn't ether but a mathematical field which obeys Einstein's laws and has a separate existence in itself besides light — (see Looking for the Harmonies by Frank Wilczek, p.g. 346 note 161).

 

·

 

It's amazing how in nature totally unconnected events have the same laws connecting them, like the number of ways “h” heads will appear if we toss a coin “n” times which is:

 

†

 

which is different than the number of combinations of n things taken h at a time  but  both have the exact same equation:

†

 

Another example is cosh  xdx  =  sinh x + c  and cos xdx = sin x + c . Even  though

†

have been unconnected until Euler found the connection. The new ideas in the field of chaos also illustrate this. These are indicative of inner connections that cause dissimilar things to be connected by the same laws. [Something connected with this is the fact that the Schwarzschild radius comes out to be exactly the same as if it was formulated in Newtonian terms thus:

 

1/2mv2=GmM/r,so R=2GM/c2]

 

[Also in basic first year Physics, some of the laws of different systems turn out identical, both in mechanics and in electro-magnetism.]

 

 

·

 

The microscopic world is based on probability while the macroscopic world is based on classical physics. The connection is that between the world of chaos and of correction. Chaos is the higher root but then from the elements of chaos (atoms) God created the macroscopic world based on correction. Spiritually also we are only microscopically subject to the laws of chaos but our macroscopic souls are based on correction. So its true that individual prayer depends on not being observed only on the higher level of chaos but there still is a level of correction where flow exists despite being observed.

 

·

 

The number of laws of the Torah (10 general, 613 specific) equals the number of the components of the field of the empty space (i.e. 10 sephirot, and 613 parts of the soul). Of the Ten Commandments only the last 6 determine the rate of spiritual change while the first 4 limit the initial conditions, but allow for any arbitrary rate of change (this is if you go by the divisions of the Hebrew Bible and count every paragraph as one commandment. This is actually how the Catholic Church divides them.)) The reason for the division 6 and 4 is that the letter He (the 5 colors) divides up into a Vav (6) and a Dalet (4) as it comes down through the world of waves (Akudim). Then the Vav is divided into two Vavs, 6 quarks and 6 leptons. From here it seems that the 6 quarks and leptons come from the 6 field equations of General Relativity that determine future events.

 

·

 

The determinant of the matrix that determines the universe isn't equal to zero, so that matrix has to have a unique solution — and so it has to have the same number of variables as equations. I think that gives a 4x4 matrix, since the variables are the position in space and time.

 

·26

 

The inverse-square laws of the universe come as one equation:

 

KMm + G M m m + (some constant for the weak force) M m + (some constant for the strong force) M m=r2 [This is the equation of a 4D sphere].

 

 

·

 

“When a rotating black hole forms the outer horizon it settles like a quivering bubble toward the ultimate stable state represented by Kerr's solution to Einstein's equations. This quivering of the outer horizon produces ripples in space-time, gravitational waves, that spread both outward and inward. The ones that fall in are blue shifted. Since , the inflow of blue shifted gravitational radiation that carries energy will produce an increase in the mass inside the black hole, increasing a core mass that starts out with just five times the mass of the sun going to 1057 times the mass of the entire universe.

 

This can't reach the outer universe, but at the big crunch when all the black holes merge, such intense gravitational fields are involved that the whole universe will collapse to the Plank scale. The rest of the collapse takes only 10-43 seconds (Plank time).

 

At that time the Bekenstein-Hawking formula for the entropy of the black hole becomes meaningless and the total entropy is reduced drastically.

 

At the same time, because there is no duration less than 10-43 seconds (just like there is no distance shorter than 10-33 centimeters), the collapsing universe 10-43 seconds away from the singularity bounces back to become an expanding universe (since this doesn't defy entropy).

 

This does away (almost) with the problem of the buildup of entropy from one cycle of an oscillating universe to the next. But there still is a small buildup of entropy from one cycle to the next. It seems possible that the origins of the universe can be traced back through successively shorter cycles to some initial tiny seed, a baby universe produced by a quantum fluctuation out of nothing at all”.

-- Unveiling The Edge of Time, by John Gribbin

 

“And God said let there be light, and there was light.” -- Genesis 1:3

 

·28

 

DpxDt³(h/4p) is also a quality which is impossible to know the exact amount. This may relate to uncertainty of momentum or time. For the uncertainty of momentum is inversely proportional to p.

 

·

 

The speed of light is the same for all observers because it is the speed of time through the 5th dimension.

 

·

 

The idea of the four elements of air, fire, water and ground is quite literal (but also simply means the states of energy, gas, liquid and solid. The Kabbalah, when it took over this idea from the Greeks, meant it in a different way than the Greeks, i.e., that the four letters of the Ineffable Name permeate every aspect of creation. So, on every level there is a division into four parts which are really 8 because the Kabbalah puts together the Ineffable Name with Adonai e.g., each of the four represent a state, but also represent the actual substances that make up fire or water. I would like to suggest my own four primordial substances that existed in the early universe quarks, leptons, photons, gluons (ground, water, fire, air).

 

·

 

I would like to suggest that String Theory has its roots in the four flows coming from Adam Kadmon: notes, vowels, crowns and letters, -- e.g., the Crown of Wisdom are musical notes, and the nine lower sephirot are the vowels, and the Crown of Understanding are the crowns of the letters, and the lower nine sephirot are letters.

 

Now all of these four levels are in the form of letters, but the letters of the Crown of Wisdom are in the form of musical notes. The crowns themselves are letters in the form of the circular notes e.g.

 

 

i.e., closed strings -- the open strings are vowels and crowns. This works amazingly well, for it is a great principle in kabbalah that each particle in the physical realm contains a letter. When we find that the letters themselves come in this way, it seems to be a confirmation of string theory in Kabbalah, though it is far from confirmed in the physical realm. [I know that looks suspiciously like the tertiary structures of the proteins.]

 

 

 

 

·

 

 

This is probably superfluous to mention but I find it very interesting that the DNA molecule have 26 parts which is the numerical value of the Four letter name of God יה”וה which relates to the sepherah of Beauty which is the sepherah of Man. The bases GTCA clearly are the four letters Aleph Dalet Nun Yod, thus:

 

 

And their inner root is Yod He Vav He and the specific shape of the letter Aleph determines the structure of the DNA, i.e., the bottom “kotz” is the base, or Malchut... [The Vav is an extended Yod.] The fifteen operations are the numerical value of the first two letters י”ה. Now, here the connections are clear, but what would be the result of knowing this I don't know.

 

I suspect that with this knowledge each discipline can teach about the other, but this job is usually left for the discoverer of the idea itself. Each nucleotide is made up of three letters which correspond to the division of the name 72 into groups of three letters each:

[ {acid(ACGT), base(phosphate), sugar(ribose)} = {judgement, beauty, kindness}.]

 

There are 10 nucleotides per revolution which corresponds to the  10 letters of the name 45. The DNA is Kindness and Judgement together [the name 72 and 42, each containing ten four-letter names as the inner light].

 

Out of this combination comes the mRNA [beauty, the name 22]. It goes through the three lower sephirot Eternity, Splendor, Foundation -- and out comes Royalty: the proteins.

 

·33

 

Even though there is no known way of summing up all infinitely many Feynman diagrams, to get an expression for a fully renormalized electron, I think the secret may be contained in an idea along these lines: the area under the curve of y=1/x is finite even though it is infinitely long i.e.,  . Thus, there is a way for the strange loops that encompass creation to be brought down to one point though we may not know what it is.

 

·

 

The five Peano Axioms[12] capture the essence of natural numbers as the axioms of Euclid capture the essence of Plane Geometry. After one has them, he can theoretically build up by axioms and rules of logic the complete system. These axioms are the atoms of the system and correspond to the five partzufim [forms] of Crown, Father, Mother, Son, Daughter. The five axioms of Human behavior are the last five of the Ten Commandments. [This is in accordance with the Rambam's way of looking at the commandments as having their reality and essence in pure logic. According to him, the commandments have a reality separate from the fact that they are written in the Torah -- for even if they weren't we would have to obey them from reason. Thus, I am inclined to believe that these last five are axioms in the sense that transgressing them evokes a bad reaction on a person as a law of nature. Thus, even in cases where one thinks he has some permission from the Oral Law, I think one shouldn't depend on it.

 

·

 

I think gravity is simply an inverse rubber band, i.e., matter pulls space-time out of shape. But instead of the distortion in shape pulling things apart it pushes them together. [I also think the electro-magnetic field is the same thing].

 

 

 

 

 

 

Chapter 3 – Torah Ideas

·

 

And God said, “let there be light and there was light.” That is the thread of his infinite light which shone into the darkness of the empty space.

And God said, “Let there be a firmament,” which was the roof top of the empty space to divide between his infinite light, and the empty space.

 

The waters above the empty space I don't know. The waters below are the space-time continuum.

 

The seven days of creation are the seven circles of light before the straight light was created.

The luminaries are wisdoms letting in God's infinite light, through the firmament into the empty space.

 

·

 

The non-Jews at the time of Mordechai and Ester: The 1st verse says they became Jewish because the fear of the Jews fell upon them, i.e. the fear of that which the Jews fear fell upon them, i.e. fear of the punishment of God. A later verse says they became Jewish because the fear of Mordechai fell upon them, i.e. that fear that Mordechai feared, i.e. fear and awe of the greatness of God.

 

·

 

“The king of Sodom said to Abraham give me the soul and the money take for yourself”, i.e., the evil inclination offers one lots of money as long as he sells his soul.

 

·

 

God said to Abraham go from your land from your birthplace and your father's house to the land I will show you, i.e., from the 3 dimensions of his world into the 4th dimension. Later, this actually occurred as the sages say on the verse, “and He took him outside,” i.e., out of the 3D of this world. (This idea is hinted to in one of Rabbi Nachman's stories.)

 

·

 

The trait of Abraham is kindness. Therefore, his test was to see if he could be cruel in a case where God demanded it. The trait of Jacob is truth, therefore his test was to see if he could lie in the case where God demanded it. For Gods will is the definition of truth and kindness. — so, when God commands a cruel deed that deed is by definition kind. That is why the verse attributes kindness to Abraham, because he was willing to be cruel when God demanded it. So, when he was kind we know the kindness was real because it was connected to God. The same goes for Jacob.

 

·

 

Abraham could be a Lamdan [dialectic Talmudic scholar] when he wanted to. He said, “She is my sister,” even though he had to stretch the truth beyond recognition to say so. But when God told him “Bring up Issac as a burn offering,” in which case he could have said it means bring up, i.e., put him on the alter and then take him down — which was in fact the final intention. But when it came to a commandment of God he didn't try to find a way out by using semantics.

 

·

 

How did Esther know on the 2nd day to ask the King her request and not the 1st? Because on the 1st day he asked “What is your request, Esther,” but on the 2nd day he asked  “What is your request, Queen Esther?”

 

·

 

On the 3rd day (the 3rd trait Beauty — the 3rd day when the Torah was given) Esther (the Divine Presence) stood before the inner house of the King (the singularity of infinite light in the center of the empty space). She was wearing the surrounding light so the King was pleased with her. He reached out with the golden rod (the thin beam of his infinite light). She touched it and was saved.

 

·

 

Every verse in the Torah is a matrix by which the subject of that verse comes into being. A matrix is an array of numbers, each representing the value of a variable. These variables can be algebraic, here I mean the term to be applied to spiritual variables and variable equations in the creation.

 

·

 

On Rosh HaShanah there is a new Big Bang due to the reversing of Einstein's equations for a black hole. On Yom Kippur time stands still because the light from Rosh HaShanah gets to the bottom of the empty space where there is the singularity. So, as a result of repentance one should experience a new birth.

 

·

 

The days of creation are actually the 7 divine traits and not time at all. Only in the lower garden of Eden did time pass. In the upper garden of Eden it is still Friday, the day Adam was thrown out. After Adam was thrown out he began to measure time at the rate of the physical universe. This is not dependent on the ‘Shemita opinion.’ It's just that in the higher and lower worlds time passes at different rates — and in Atzilus there is no time at all. However, this can go along with the Shemita opinion — for as time went slowly in Gan Eden, billions of years passed in the physical universe.

 

(The Shemita opinion puts us in the 4th cycle of 7000 year periods each of which has a 1000 year day. This is the opinion of Rabbi Issaac of Acco who lived about 800 years ago. It's interesting that this opinion corresponds to modern astronomy). However, if we accept that Rabbi Nachman objected to the Shemita principle then it is possible that the time axis of the physical universe was simply folded up into a little ball of string where theoretically you could have miles of string in the distance of a few inches. The Shemita idea seems to be supported by the fact that the Torah says that first God created heaven and earth without saying how long that took. Then it goes through a different world of creation in which there was a spiritual garden of Eden that Adam was placed in. This isn't in the physical universe at all. Then, it says he was thrown out of the garden of Eden and into the physical world which had been created before that. So, an honest look at the Torah shows that it never even implies anywhere how long the creation of the physical universe was.

 

·

 

The contradiction between the Divine fore-knowledge and free will is that God knows what one will chose not just from the future but from now (i.e. not just because He knows the future). This contradiction is the root of Quantum Mechanics.

 

·

 

Creativity on the right side of the brain is from the sepherah of Wisdom. Order is from the left from the sepherah of Understanding. Logical creativity which relates to order, and a deeper creativity, is the combination of the two called Knowledge — but all three permeate the entire body as it says in Drush HaDaas at the end of the Eitz Chayim.

 

The deeper creativity is much more covered, and with the vessel of Eternity Splendor and Foundation of Understanding and Eternity, Splendor and Foundation of Wisdom. (This last comment is referring just to Emanation, which is different than the whole picture referred to in Drush HaDaas.) Thus, we find creative people who aren't smart — because smartness in general is from the sepherah of understanding which is open and quick to understand. But the deeper sepherah of Wisdom is slow and not quick to understand, but after a long process of absorbing the idea, it is able to create something totally new — which the left-brain people reject, because it's too off-beat for them. Thus, we find that Einstein was a slow learner.

 

·

 

Everything under the level of the lower six sephirot (which are opposites) turns into its opposite and then back again, in constant oscillation. So we find the enlightened Islam of the middle ages becoming the barbaric Islam of today, and the dark Christianity of the Middle Ages becoming the loving Christianity of today. The same loving Chasidut of the Baal Shem Tov has become the fascist Chasidut of today. Only by one rising up to the level of the 3 first sephirot can one escape this pattern. I think science is in its root on that level (i.e. what the sages call the higher wisdom) However when science falls from its higher root it can become just a tool for evil (the Torah is on the level of Beauty one of the lower sephirot.)

 

 

·

 

When the angel called out, “Abraham Abraham” and he said “here I am” and he said “put out not your hand to the child, and do nothing to him for now I know that you fear God, and you have not withheld your son, your only one from me.” (Or more literally your singularity from me i.e. the center part of his being i.e. the center of the black hole.)

 

·

 

The Torah applies on many different levels, the microscopic and macroscopic, e.g., the interactions between subatomic particles is described in the parashah of forbidden sexual relationships, e.g., the interaction of an electron and an anti-electron is described by the law on the prohibition of sex between a brother and sister. The Torah also applies to the physics of stars and higher spiritual planes. On the human level also there are many levels of application. People can keep the Shabbat on a physical level but sill desecrate it on a spiritual level and vise versa.

 

·

 

The reason Rabbi Nachman says “There is nothing besides Him” is literal in the Torah the subject of the verb is understood to be ‘the doer of the verb” without its being written. So the subject of the verb exists is 'anything that does it', and here the verse is saying there is nothing which does this verb except God.

 

 

·

 

After Eliezer saw that Rivka had fulfilled his conditions why wasn't he convinced that she was the right one? He asked give me water and she agreed and then she said and I will give water to all your camels too. And thus she did. Why wasn't that enough “why does it say after that the man was astounded at her, being quiet to know if God had given  him success or not? The answer is the next verse, “When the camels finished drinking then he took the jewelry etc.” For you can give a camel to drink and it can finish it and you have to give it more. Eliezer wanted to see if she would do more than just do what she said she would do. He wanted to see if she would COMPLETE what she said she would do. Only then could he know that she was worthy to be Issac's wife.

 

·

 

“And Moses called to Betzalel and  to Eliav and to every person wise of heart that God put wisdom in his heart, all that decided to come close to the work to do it.” Exodus 36:2. It is clear that just by the fact that they wanted to do God's work, God gave them the wisdom necessary to do it. Wisdom isn't necessary to learn, only the desire to do the work and to actually do it. The wisdom God will add later.

 

·

 

The idea of the Strange Loop exists in the Torah, e.g., “Remember what Amalek did to you.” Now, if the Torah hadn't commanded us to forget Amalek, no one would remember him. But, since the Torah commands us to be sure not to forget to forget Amalek, now we all remember him.

 

Just like the double negatives in genetics. Even Hegel noticed the double negatives. These things indicate a deeper level. Just like for number theory to be correct we need to postulate super-numbers. [This indicates the need for the Oral Law. However, since the 13 principles, by which the Torah is explained, teaches that such contradictions need to be explained by a third verse which is on the level of the written law, so I am not so sure about this last point unless we go like the Rambam who considers the things derived by the Thirteen Principles to be Rabbinical. Perhaps the Torah itself hints to its own inner level?]

 

·

 

The Strange Loops exist through the Torah. We do all the mitzvot in gratitude that God brought us out of slavery, but we are allowed to own slaves. Yaakov lied saying I am Esau, but we attribute the trait of Truth to him, “Give truth to Yakov...” [Unless that means give him truth because he doesn't have any]. But if the spies to Israel said the truth we get on their backs. We borrow the money of the Egyptians, but we don't give it back because we earned it, but we don't pay back our slaves. Abraham was ready to do a very cruel deed, but we attribute the trait of kindness to him. “Honor your father and mother”, yet Moses praised the tribe of Levi for killing their parents when they were guilty of idolatry. “Who says to his father and mother I have not seen them...”

 

The truth is, all these things point to a deeper level, as strange loops do. [But the simple explanation is that the patriarchs and the Jewish people were and are flawed, but God chose them anyway.

 

·

 

Every openly evil deed done by anyone Jewish in the Bible we have an excuse — e.g., for “The Holy spirit told him so.” Every good deed by a non-Jew we attribute it to evil motives. The reason is that the Talmud was written at a period of extreme animosity towards the Gentiles. Now even though it is inspired by God it still comes through the vessels of the souls of the people then.

 

·

 

Abraham said, “the gods tricked me”. Apparently, he believed there are other gods but that they are under the rule of the One Creator. This isn't a new point. The Sages obviously believed the angels or princes appointed over each nation is its god, and Michael is the archangel of Israel, as it says in Daniel.

 

·

 

When Rashi says ‘Tikun Sofrim’ it means simply that the verse was changed later by the sofrim. Apparently, this happened also in the verse “he set the boundaries of the nations according to the number of the children of Israel.” The Dead Sea Scrolls have the number of the children of God. This isn't apikorsus to believe — unless you want to say too that Rashi was an apikorus. To tell the truth, modern orthodoxy would consider the Rambam also to be an apikorus.

 

·

 

The oral law are the meanings that the written text triggers, and the written law is the open and hidden meanings that are contained in the text itself. In reality, there is no way to totally understand the meaning of any verse of the torah since that would mean understanding the implications of its connections to every person until the end of time. That is why there is no infallible method for telling true from false statements in number theory —because statements imply meaning, which has infinite levels. [GEB, p. 561, 582]

 

·

 

The dichotomy between Relativity and quantum mechanics is possibly related to the Strange Loops in Mathematical logic, i.e.,  relativity is from the sephirot of Yosher, and quantum reality is from Igulim.

 

·

 

There is a special type of holiness the Patriarchs handed down one to the other. This is the subject of the blessings. This is different than a normal blessing one gives to another but a special type of holiness in quality and quantity. This came to Joseph as Rashi explains on the verses of the blessing Yakob gave to him. Rashi says there “The blessing of the Patriarchs”. Thus the Jewish people are only the physical descendants of the Patriarchs. To find the people that received the blessing of Joseph one would have to know where his two tribes went to, for the Jewish people today are Judah and Benjamin. It seems there is a different spiritual Israel, different than the Jewish people that received this blessing.

                                                                                  [28]

Each sentence of the Torah has a noun which is the root of matter and a verb which is the root of energy.So the four worlds corresponding to the four Hebrew words for doing or making refer to the four forces.The strong force- physicality.The weak force-formation. The electromagnetic force-creation.Gravitation Emanation.

 

 

 

Chapter 4 – Rabbi Nachman from Breslov

 

·

 

Rabbi Nachman is the only tzadik that allows himself to be tested experimentally by making solid statistical predictions easy to test experimentally. E.g. “Shabbat and the Torah give physical life (not just spiritual).” Although you can say that the Christians have Jesus which balances that out, but then you could test it with religious and non-religious Jews. Honesty shouldn't make a difference for their degree of honesty isn't that different. Now there are lots of differences by each individual like smoking but or going to Uman for Rosh Hashanah, but all the variables should average out to give people who keep Shabbat and learn Torah a longer life.

 

·2

 

Rabbi Nachman's ideas in the Lekutei Moharan are general principles applying to people, and to show the inter-relationship between the ideas, but not as advice. This is because any general principal changes dramatically when applied to the individual and only the individual himself can know how it applies to him. This is the idea of uniting Correction and Chaos together, for when you draw the higher light of Chaos into the vessels of Correction you get a different result than drawing the light of Correction into the vessels of Chaos.

 

·

 

 

(Power) x (t)/(m)x(a)=x;

 

i.e., the distance the sephirot are lifted during the year. This is why it's important to go to Uman on Rosh Hashanah, for the vertical column of light of power is there.

 

·

 

Rabbi Nachman hints at the basic principle of Quantum Mechanics, that seeing makes the vessel (i.e. that observing the photon wave makes it take particle form. (It's interesting to note that in the Eitz Chayim of Rabbi Issac Luria, mass (the vessel) is considered dense energy, so apparently he knew intuitively the mass energy equivalence).

 

·

 

In the Lekutai Moharan we find many things which lead to the divine spirit or salvation etc. These are independent variables that effect the final result. So lets say children are dependent on the land of Israel, the succah, prayer etc. Then, children = A(land of Israel) + B(succah) + C(prayer) + …… + D; where A, B, C and D are constants. So, if succah and prayer would remain the same, and the land of Israel would go up by one unit, then children would go up by an amount of A. We assume here that the effects of the land of Israel and Succah and prayer are additive, i.e., that the amount that Succah effects them doesn't depend on the amount that the land of Israel affects them.

 

We could use a computer with a statistical package to get the values of the coefficients (even though it's probable that every person would end up having his own coefficients). Also, we could use the t statistic to test the possibility that one of these things has no effect on children. To prove to the doubters, who say that none of these things have an effect we could use the F statistic. You could do this with every chapter in the Lekutai Moharan and thus come out with some results for all the coefficients, which could serve for some practical guidance in ones life. [For it is likely that people’s coefficients don't vary that much one from one another.]

 

Without knowing the value of the coefficients, it’s impossible to know how much each variable effects the situation, and since doing one mitzvah (commandment) invariably takes time and effort from another one, one can verify what he should be doing in order to achieve his goals. (Even though you may have different coefficients than everybody else, it’s unlikely that yours will be significantly different than your immediate peer group, so if you have a general idea of the value of the statistics you can know what you should emphasize without having to waste years experimenting with things that may have little effect on your overall happiness). Even though it is true that much depends on your own trust in God and other variables, so you could ask how is it possible to reduce your personal happiness and success in so many areas as the Lekutai Moharan does to a simple mathematical formula.

 

The answer is that much of one's own trust in God can be determined by his peer group, for no righteous or great person appears in a vacuum. Baba Sali in Morocco was surrounded by a spirit of fear of God. Spinoza and Rabbi Moshe Chayim Lutzato were deeply affected by the atmosphere of philosophy in Amsterdam (why else would Rabbi Lutzato be the sole saint to create a coherent philosophical analysis of the Kabbalah, very similar to what Spinoza did for philosophy in general).

 

·

 

By doing repentance on a sin you get some Divine inspiration. Then, you do repentance again since you realize your first repentance wasn't good enough in accordance with your increased awareness of God's greatness. The second time you repent, your repentance is better so you get a higher degree of inspiration, i.e., inspiration times some number k which is more than one. The third time you repent you increase your previous inspiration [which was (inspiration)(k)] by a factor of k again — since your inspiration was increased by by that amount. So you get (inspiration) (k2) If you do that n times, your inspiration will be (inspiration) (k2). Now back to the beginning. At the time you did the second repentance you also do a repentance on your first repentance since your realize that it wasn't complete. The first time you repent on your first repentance you get some inspiration. The second time you get (inspiration)(k). The next time you get (inspiration) (k2). Now, at the time you do your third repentance on the sin, and the second repentance on the first repentance, you do your first repentance on the second repentance.

 

So at the time you have done this process n times you have Inspiration(kn) + inspiration (kn-1) +…+ inspiration. If you take the limit as you do this an infinite number of times you get the  Integral(inspiration) (kn)] dn = (Inspiration) (kn)/(ln k) where the ln k signifies the lower dot of the aleph [the Divine name 52] and the dividing sign is the line dividing the aleph and kn is the top dot of the aleph [the Divine name 161].

 

·

 

The way of learning of Rabbi Nachman includes two different points. One that just by saying the words the understanding comes into the mind. The other is to learn in order without skipping around. My idea of saying the words backwards comes from the Ari and the aal Shem Tov who have different unifications based on that idea, and the Ramchal explains in his New Zohar that the saying of the words backwards brings the light back to the source -- so it's like sewing -- where it is helpful to go backwards also. The practical way of implementing this is to have a place marker in the several books that one needs to learn and have a certain fixed amount that one does of each one each day.

 

·

 

In that same lesson in the Lekutai Moharan, vol 1. chapt. 6, we see that the amount that the honor of God is increased depends on how much the person has changed from a state of sin to the state of good and the change one has of greater honor to lesser, i.e. the honor of God isn't dependent on one's being good but rather on change from a lower to a higher state, and similarly there is a need for an active lessening of ones own honor. Therefore the proper relationship is:

 

Honor of God = D State of goodness is that goodness or goodness] / D Self-honor.

Since these are two independent variables as we take the limit as DC®0, Dy® 0 we we have:<???> <Clear up the last paragraph please?>

 

†

The general solution of this linear partial differential equation will contain two arbitrary functions. I think they are the finding of one's proper partner as mentioned in Lekutai Moharan [vol 2] and becoming included in the Higher Man who sits on the Throne which is the result of doing the higher and lower repentance of chap. 6. This would explain why these two things result from the higher and lower repentance mentioned in this chapter [i.e., chapter 6 of the Lekutai Moharan]

 

 

·

 

If one has masturbated he should say the 10 psalms, 16, 32, 41, 42, 57, 77, 90, 105, 137, 150 and immerse himself in a natural body of water all on that same day as Rabbi Nachman said.

 

·

 

To sweeten the judgments, I would recommend having in every city at least one person learning Zohar, Lekutei Moharan and other kabbalah books in such a way that when he is tired there is another to take his place and continue from the place he stopped. [See Ginzay HaRamchal where I got this idea from.]

 

This would be good in particular by the graves of the righteous where the lower level of their soul hovers. For the individual can say the ten psalms of Rabbi Nachman, 16, 32, 41, 42, 59, 77, 90, 105, 137, 150 which are on the level of the crown, then the Song of songs on the level of wisdom, then Numbers ch. 28, on the level of understanding than Exodus chapt. 28:15 to 28:30, then Exodus 26:7 to 26:15; the part about the increase in the prayer book, the two blessings that Moses blessed the tribes at the end of Deuteronomy and the divine chariot in Ezikiel.

 

·

 

Time is in Kabbalah a ‘perfect form’ and has 613 parts, and an inner essence, and an outer essence. The faster one goes the closer he gets to the inner essence, and thus time slows down. (This is what Rabbi Nachman calls “the time becomes unified into one and the length becomes shorter — what Rabbi Nachman calls “The Place” becomes unified into one. Here, Rabbi Nachman predicts the existence of black-holes with a singularity inside).

 

This means that time is like an electro-magnetic wave that flows through the time field. So, one year is four spiritual waves, the Rosh Hashanah wave starting and finishing on Rosh Hashanah. (But this is different in terms that its highest point is on Shavuot and lowest on Tisha BeAv), and at right angles to it is the month wave (starting in Nissan), and at a right angle to that is the week wave and then there is the day wave, so the whole thing is one big shear wave in 4 dimensions traveling through the time field like a gravitational wave in the space time field. Rabbi Nachman says the month wave used to start on Passover (i.e. like a cosine function where the origin is the highest point but now he says it originates on Purim.

 

·

 

There are infinite levels that the Lekutai Moharan works on. The Lekutai Moharan was meant to be valid and consistent at every possible level as I heard once from some university professor on the way to Rabbi Nachman for Rosh Hashanah. Before that I had believed that every level in it was one specific level and my only question was how to verify which level it was speaking about. Now I believe that in each specific world the Lekutai Moharan has a specific level but it applies to each world differently. I also think that the books of the Baal HaTanya in general contain the hints necessary to decipher the intent of the Lekutai Moharan in Emanation.

 

·

 

Rabbi Nachman predicts the fact that in a large gravitational field, time slows down, for by the Divine Presence where there is a large amount of energy he says the time becomes unified into a singularity.

 

·

 

Rabbi Nachman said even on the left side there is a right and a left. This means that all spiritual systems are like a vertical totem pole with the wisdom on top but what determines a person's spirituality isn't the vertical level but the horizontal closeness to the vertical column (of the infinite light). For instance, lets say a person is Jewish — that puts him on a high rung of the ladder. But it doesn't have anything to do with whether he is good or evil. Only the horizontal closeness to  determines that. [i.e., only the x-coordinate determines good or evil. The y-coordinate determines the rung of existence], and further even in good or evil there is right and left. That is, the evil of evil or the good of evil, i.e. that even an evil person won't go to that degree of evil.

 

·

 

Concerning the way of learning recommended by Rabbi Nachman — of just saying the words in order, and having faith that one will eventually understand — it is interesting to see the Maharsha on Avoda Zara 19a, who says that the two ways of learning of just saying the words, or being exact, and repeating the ideas over and over until one gets it is a argument in the Gemara over there.

 

Then, the Gemara says that the rabbis knew the statements about learning carefully but didn't listen to it because they followed the advice of just saying the words. To the Maharsha, Rav Nachman bar Issac learned in the quick way but still had success in his learning. [The argument if Sinai is better or uprooter of mountains would also seem to be relevant. The Gemara concludes that Sinai is better.] <???> <What do you mean by uprooter of mountains or sinai?>

 

·

 

There are five books of Rabbi Nachman: three are his exact words, and two are the things Rabbi Nathan remembered that he said and wrote down. There are no other traditions from him contrary to what is commonly supposed.

 

For instance, there is a commonly known saying which he said, that there would be no other Rebbi after him. However, when a Rav of Breslov died in Safed years ago, all the Breslovers made it a point to advertise throughout the Jewish community in New York that the Rav of Breslov had died for the publicity they would get from it. No Breslover then in Jerusalem, or New York, or Safed said anything about this supposed tradition.

 

However, when only a few years later when Rav Shick started printing books that had his picture on them, and written underneath was, “The Leader of Breslov” [and Rav Shick was already very unpopular with the Breslover community for years] all of a sudden this tradition popped up.

 

Now when did Rabbi Nachman say it? If before the guy from Safed died, why did nobody remember it then? Then it must be that it was after that guy died. But Rabbi Nachman himself passed away two hundred years ago. So it is obvious that Rabbi Nachman never said such a thing — and this is just another example of a very common phenomenon I have noticed in the Orthodox community, i.e., making up history to suit their political and financial needs.

 

·

Though Rabbi Nachman attacked the Guide to the Perplexed, there are many principles that he gets from there, like that “taking care of the body comes before taking care of the soul,” (Guide III:27). Or the idea that prophecy is an extension of the power of imagination [the Guide II:38], the idea that prophecy is by an angel to all prophets except Moses [the Guide II:24].

 

·

 

Advice from Rabbi Nachman has to be taken with a grain of salt, i.e., what he would call Tzitzum. The mikvah may be able to sweeten judgements but what about the guy that was killed in Israel going to the mikvah and the child that died after his parent put him in the  freezing mikvah of the Ari. in Safed.Even if one has had seed come out of him at night, Rabbi Nachman said it is nothing unless it came also with sexual thoughts. The reason the mikvah no  longer works like it did for the Baal Shem Tov is that for him it was a time for  private prayer. Now that it is no longer private it is a waste of time unless in the case that Rabbi Nachman specifically said it for.

All the advice of Rabbi Nachman has to be taken in this way--think: “Will this action increase my devakus in God ?” If the logical answer to that question is no then even if Rabbi Nachman said it is a good thing to do, he meant it for a different situation than the one that exists now for you.
